articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel will gradually withdraw its forces over 60 days as Lebanon's army takes control of territory near its border with Israel to ensure that Hezbollah does not rebuild its infrastructure there.
articles.title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire, brokered by US and France, aims for permanent peace

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: The two superpowers are setting out their positions ahead of Trump's return to the White House.
articles.title: China state media warn Trump against mutually destructive tariff war

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump's team is discussing pursuing direct talks with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, hoping a fresh diplomatic push can lower the risks of armed conflict, according to two people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump team weighs direct talks with North Korea's Kim in new diplomatic push, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Ukrainian delegation led by Defence Minister Rustem Umerov is visiting South Korea this week to ask for weapons aid to be used by Kyiv in its war with Russia, according to media reports.
articles.title: Ukrainian delegation visiting Seoul to ask for weapons aid, media reports say

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China is likely to launch military drills in the coming days near Taiwan, using President Lai Ching-te's upcoming trip to the Pacific and scheduled U.S. transit as a pretext, according to assessments by Taiwan and regional security officials.
articles.title: China could launch military drills near Taiwan over president's Pacific visit, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China Defence Minister Dong Jun has been placed under investigation as part of a wide-ranging anti-corruption probe that has roiled the top ranks of the People's Liberation Army, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: China defence minister placed under investigation for corruption, FT reports

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: An Australian Senate committee has backed a bill that would ban social media for children under 16 but said social media platforms should not force users to submit personal data such as passport and other digital identification to prove their age.
articles.title: Australia Senate committee backs bill to ban social media for children

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Malaysian court on Wednesday allowed corruption charges linked to the 1MDB scandal filed against jailed former Prime Minister Najib Razak and the former treasury chief to be dropped, media reports said.
articles.title: Malaysia drops 1MDB-linked charges against ex-PM Najib, treasury official, reports say

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: An Australian police officer who fatally shocked a 95-year-old care home resident with a Taser gun was found guilty of manslaughter on Wednesday.
articles.title: Australian police officer who Tasered 95-year-old found guilty of manslaughter

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian forces have taken an area half the size of London over the past month, analysts and war bloggers say.
articles.title: Russia accelerates advance in Ukraine's east
